name: M&A terminology question
description: User asks about M&A terminology - no tool call needed

input.user_message: What does LOI mean in the context of M&A?

mock_response.response_text: LOI stands for Letter of Intent. In M&A, it's a document outlining the preliminary understanding between a buyer and seller before conducting due diligence. It typically covers the proposed price, deal structure, and exclusivity period.
